p: As of March 13, 2020, outside China, there were 32 countries with more than 100 COVID-19 cases [ 104]. The highest number of infections was found in seven countries: the United States (n = 2294), France (n = 3671), Germany (n = 3675), Spain (n = 5232), South Korea (n = 8086), Iran (n = 11,364), and Italy (n = 17,660). The number of confirmed cases in the other 25 countries was fewer than 1200 [ 105]. The related data is presented in Table 3.
